Hi Nicollette, 

Sorry for the delay. We have added a custom field to the Insights Article/ News so we can add the image 002 to the bottom of the website and the one named Insurance to be at the top of the article.
.
Here are the links:
https://www.bellpartners.com/insights/
https://www.bellpartners.com/insights/how-to-put-resilience-on-your-risk-management-radar/

Let us know if you need further assistance.

@ricaV2 All good on this one. I have created a 2nd Featured Image. Defaults to Featured Image if this is empty.
+30mins Thanks!
@joel need your help with this. Thanks!

Hi Rica,

Is it possible to use both images ?

So the one named image 002 to be at the bottom of the website and the one named Insurance to be at the top of the article ?

Should you have any queries, please do not hesitate to contact this office.



Warm Regards,

Nicollette Papas

Executive Assistant to the

Managing Director of Accounting & Tax Advisory

Hi Nicollete, 

I'm sorry for the confusion. Please let her know that we are using one image on Insights article which is the featured image. It would be best if you can provide us with a high resolution image for the image I attached.

And attach the image file directly to the email not insert it inside the email as it might compress the image's size

Hi Rico,

Please see below email from Emily in regards to this article.

If you could use both pictures that I supplied to you yesterday and make the changes requested below, that would be great.

sorry if I've confused you, or maybe I'm just totally misunderstanding how the BP website is built, but I had assumed you needed 2 different images sizes..one for the Insights menu page and one for each article page and so I supplied 2 images:

1. A wider image without a subhead for the article page (this is now appearing correctly)

2. A smaller image with a subhead for the insights page (this was what you had used before).



Because you're now using the wider image on both spots, the image looks the wrong size on the Insights menu page (the articles don't line up nicely anymore). If it's possible to use the 2 images (each in their correct spot) then please do and this should fix this problem. However, if you just upload one image and it resizes it to appear in both spots then let me know what pixel size you need and I'll resupply something.





Thank you.



Warm Regards,

Nicollette Papas

Executive Assistant to the

Managing Director of Accounting & Tax Advisory
